pros: Its a great place to work and the staff are all very nice and polite and there's this air of family in the place. You will be glad you work there.
cons: None at all! It is a great place to work!

pros: Work from home and home office allowance. No need for efficiency just a turtle race work environment. No need to take pain as they usually have less expectations so no need to set the bar high. Just tell them you don't know or need more time and take it chill and it could become a time pass kinda work lol.
cons: The projects are maningless with no vision to work, inexperienced management, micromanagement, very less pay comparatively to market and women biased environment. Poor communication and delegation of work with no future visions of work at all. The staff is either old/awaiting retirement or has sad adoption personal story. Long meaningless meetings that could simply be an email, oftenly concluded with boring adoption stories or discussions that could make WTactualF am I here for???

pros: The staff is collaborative and works well together. The office environment was always fun and I loved that we all had lunch together.
cons: Being a non-profit organization, there is always a need for more funding and priorities go towards that. Not necessarily a con, just a fact of working for non-profits.

job_title: Adoption Support Coordinator in Burnaby, BC
pros: Satisfying work, valuable grass roots efforts.
cons: Toxic environment. Staff are not genuinely encouraged to share ideas and thoughts openly.
